CVE-2021-0308.title: GPT fdisk: Integer underflow — GLSA 202105-03
CVE-2021-0308.subTitle: An integer underflow in sgdisk from GPT fdisk package might allow local attacker(s) to escalate privileges.
CVE-2021-0308.background: GPT fdisk (consisting of the gdisk, cgdisk, sgdisk, and fixparts programs) is a set of text-mode partitioning tools for Linux, FreeBSD, Mac OS X, and Windows.
CVE-2021-0308.body: It was discovered that ReadLogicalParts() function in basicmbr.cc was missing a bounds check.
CVE-2021-0308.extra: A local attacker could entice a user to insert a malicious formatted block device (USB stick or SD card for example), that, when processed with sgdisk, possibly resulting in local escalation of privileges or a Denial of Service condition.

CVE-2021-20193.title: Tar: Denial of service — GLSA 202105-29
CVE-2021-20193.subTitle: A vulnerability in Tar could lead to a Denial of Service condition.
CVE-2021-20193.background: The Tar program provides the ability to create and manipulate tar archives.
CVE-2021-20193.body: It was discovered that GNU Tar had a memory leak when processing archive headers.
CVE-2021-20193.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to open a specially crafted archive using Tar, possibly resulting in a Denial of Service condition.

CVE-2021-20225.title: GRUB: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 202104-05
CVE-2021-20225.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in GRUB, the worst might allow for circumvention of UEFI Secure Boot.
CVE-2021-20225.background: GNU GRUB is a multiboot boot loader used by most Linux systems.
CVE-2021-20225.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in GRUB. Please review the CVE identifiers referenced below for details.
CVE-2021-20225.extra: Please review the referenced CVE identifiers for details.

CVE-2021-20227.title: SQLite: Remote code execution — GLSA 202103-04
CVE-2021-20227.subTitle: A vulnerability in SQLite could lead to remote code execution.
CVE-2021-20227.background: SQLite is a C library that implements an SQL database engine.
CVE-2021-20227.body: It was discovered that SQLite incorrectly handled certain sub-queries.
CVE-2021-20227.extra: A remote attacker could possibly execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the process, or cause a Denial of Service condition.

CVE-2021-32055.title: Mutt, NeoMutt: Denial of service — GLSA 202105-05
CVE-2021-32055.subTitle: A vulnerability in Mutt and NeoMutt could lead to a Denial of Service condition.
CVE-2021-32055.background: Mutt is a small but very powerful text-based mail client.
CVE-2021-32055.body: NeoMutt is a command line mail reader (or MUA). It’s a fork of Mutt with added features.
CVE-2021-32055.extra: It was discovered that Mutt, and NeoMutt did not properly handle certain situations where an IMAP sequence set ends with a comma.

CVE-2021-3516.title: libxml2: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 202107-05
CVE-2021-3516.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in libxml2, the worst of which could result in a Denial of Service condition.
CVE-2021-3516.background: libxml2 is the XML (eXtended Markup Language) C parser and toolkit initially developed for the GNOME project.
CVE-2021-3516.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in libxml2. Please review the CVE identifiers referenced below for details.
CVE-2021-3516.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to process a specially crafted XML document using an application linked against libxml2, possibly resulting in a Denial of Service condition or obtaining sensitive information.
